text: Olive Tree is a very good school. It not only helps my autism child but also helps more children. My child has been studying here for more than 3 years. Compared with before, she has made a lot of progress and learned a lot of different things. And here, I would like to thank the teachers for their selfless dedication and teaching for the children. Thank you all of you and love you allðŸ¥°

Olive Tree is a wonderful place for children with special needs. It has been a transformative experience for my daughter, who has found friends and compassionate advocates here. I deeply appreciate Mr. Chu, Teacher Dax, and the entire team for their dedication to making a difference and fostering a supportive community. They understand that both the child and the parents need support, and by addressing both, they create an environment where children have a greater chance to thrive.

Settled with olive tree after comparing and visiting several early intervention centres in Singapore. Felt most encouraged by the warmth of the teachers and therapists, which is much needed by kids with neurological development challenges Child now seeing good improvement after one term. Saw some of the negative reviews. Parents need to understand takes 2 hands to clap, your child development is a result of you and the centres efforts.

Sincerely appreciate the team in Olive Tree. Thank you for the hardwork and patience given to my kid. We have seen alot of improvement on our child. The teachers will give daily update on the kid progress or what they have learn in class. They will also share with parents how we can help the kid at home. Highly recommanded Development Center.

The Olive Tree team has been like our second family here in Singapore. They were very instrumental for each milestone my son had reached. Their early intervention program helped my son to be prepared in mainstream kindergarten. Mr. Chiu also spearheaded a support group for us fathers who are raising kids with special needs. This is very helpful for me to be more involved with my son.
